Description: Electrodermal Activity: Measures changes in skin conductance, related to sweat/arousal
Electromyography: Measures electrical activity of muscles
Respiration: Measures breathing rate and effort (e.g., with a chest band)
Photoplethysmography: Measures blood volume changes (commonly used for heart rate)
Temperature: Measures body or skin temperature
Stimulus Marker: A trigger or event marker indicating a specific point in time
Electrocardiography: Measures the electrical activity of the heart
Other EEG: EEG channels where the location cannot be found
Motion: Measures movement or acceleration (e.g., via accelerometer)
Miscellaneous: Any other signal type not fitting standard categories
